trans-unit.source: Working with Claims Aware Apps in Application Proxy
trans-unit.target: Working with Claims Aware Apps in Application Proxy

trans-unit.source: Covers how to get up and running with Azure AD Application Proxy.
trans-unit.target: Covers how to get up and running with Azure AD Application Proxy.

trans-unit.source: Working with claims aware apps in Application Proxy
trans-unit.target: Working with claims aware apps in Application Proxy

trans-unit.source: Claims aware apps perform a redirection to the STS, which in turn requests credentials from the user in exchange for a token before redirecting the user to the application.
trans-unit.target: Claims aware apps perform a redirection to the STS, which in turn requests credentials from the user in exchange for a token before redirecting the user to the application.

trans-unit.source: To enable Application Proxy to be able to work with these redirects, the following steps need to be taken to enable Application Proxy to work with claims aware applications.
trans-unit.target: To enable Application Proxy to be able to work with these redirects, the following steps need to be taken to enable Application Proxy to work with claims aware applications.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Application Proxy is a feature that is available only if you upgraded to the Premium or Basic edition of Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Application Proxy is a feature that is available only if you upgraded to the Premium or Basic edition of Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Azure Active Directory editions](active-directory-editions.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Azure Active Directory editions](active-directory-editions.md).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisite
trans-unit.target: Prerequisite

trans-unit.source: Before performing this procedure, make sure that the STS the claims aware app redirects to is available outside your on-premises network.
trans-unit.target: Before performing this procedure, make sure that the STS the claims aware app redirects to is available outside your on-premises network.

trans-unit.source: Azure portal configuration
trans-unit.target: Azure portal configuration

trans-unit.source: Publish your application according to the instructions described in [Publish applications with Application Proxy](active-directory-application-proxy-publish.md).
trans-unit.target: Publish your application according to the instructions described in [Publish applications with Application Proxy](active-directory-application-proxy-publish.md).

trans-unit.source: In the list of applications, select the claims aware app and click **Configure**.
trans-unit.target: In the list of applications, select the claims aware app and click **Configure**.

trans-unit.source: If you chose **Passthrough** as your **Preauthentication Method**, make sure to select **HTTPS** as your **External URL** scheme.
trans-unit.target: If you chose **Passthrough** as your **Preauthentication Method**, make sure to select **HTTPS** as your **External URL** scheme.

trans-unit.source: If you chose Azure Active Directory as your **Preauthentication Method**, make sure to select **None** as your **Internal Authentication Method**.
trans-unit.target: If you chose Azure Active Directory as your **Preauthentication Method**, make sure to select **None** as your **Internal Authentication Method**.

trans-unit.source: ADFS configuration
trans-unit.target: ADFS configuration

trans-unit.source: Open **ADFS Management**.
trans-unit.target: Open **ADFS Management**.

trans-unit.source: Go to **Relying Party Trusts** and right click on the app you are publishing with Application Proxy, and choose **Properties**.
trans-unit.target: Go to **Relying Party Trusts** and right click on the app you are publishing with Application Proxy, and choose **Properties**.

trans-unit.source: ![Relying Party Trusts right click on app name - screentshot][1]
trans-unit.target: ![Relying Party Trusts right click on app name - screentshot][1]

trans-unit.source: On the **Endpoints** tab, under **Endpoint type** select **WS-Federation**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Endpoints** tab, under **Endpoint type** select **WS-Federation**.

trans-unit.source: Under **Trusted URL**, enter the URL you entered in the Application Proxy under **External URL** and click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: Under **Trusted URL**, enter the URL you entered in the Application Proxy under **External URL** and click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: ![Add an Endpoint - set Trusted URL value - screenshot][2]
trans-unit.target: ![Add an Endpoint - set Trusted URL value - screenshot][2]

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
